trans-unit.source: Sets the information for a tool

target.mrk: Sets the information for a tool

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle of the window that contains the tool, or 0

seg-source.mrk: Handle of the window that contains the tool, or 0

target.mrk: Handle of the window that contains the tool, or 0

trans-unit.source: Text for the ToolTip control

seg-source.mrk: Text for the ToolTip control

target.mrk: Text for the ToolTip control

trans-unit.source: [optional] Identifier of the tool, or Window handle of the control the tool is assigned to

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Identifier of the tool, or Window handle of the control the tool is assigned to

target.mrk: [optional]
Identifier of the tool, or Window handle of the control the tool is assigned to

trans-unit.source: [optional] X coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
X coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

target.mrk: [optional]
X coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

trans-unit.source: [optional] Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

target.mrk: [optional]
Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

trans-unit.source: [optional] X coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
X coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

target.mrk: [optional]
X coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

trans-unit.source: [optional] Y coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Y coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

target.mrk: [optional]
Y coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

trans-unit.source: [optional] Flags that control the ToolTip display:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Flags that control the ToolTip display:

target.mrk: [optional]
Flags that control the ToolTip display:

trans-unit.source: $TTF_IDISHWND - Indicates that $iID is a window or control handle, instead of the ID of the tool [default]

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_IDISHWND - Indicates that $iID is a window or control handle, instead of the ID of the tool [default]

target.mrk: $TTF_IDISHWND - Indicates that $iID is a window or control handle, instead of the ID of the tool [default]

trans-unit.source: $TTF_CENTERTIP - Centers the tooltip below the control specified by $iID

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_CENTERTIP - Centers the tooltip below the control specified by $iID

target.mrk: $TTF_CENTERTIP - Centers the tooltip below the control specified by $iID

trans-unit.source: $TTF_RTLREADING - Indicates that text will be displayed in the opposite direction (right to left)

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_RTLREADING - Indicates that text will be displayed in the opposite direction (right to left)

target.mrk: $TTF_RTLREADING - Indicates that text will be displayed in the opposite direction (right to left)

trans-unit.source: $TTF_SUBCLASS - Indicates that the control should subclass the tool's window [default]

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_SUBCLASS - Indicates that the control should subclass the tool's window [default]

target.mrk: $TTF_SUBCLASS - Indicates that the control should subclass the tool's window [default]

trans-unit.source: $TTF_TRACK - Positions the tooltip window next to the tool to which it corresponds

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_TRACK - Positions the tooltip window next to the tool to which it corresponds

target.mrk: $TTF_TRACK - Positions the tooltip window next to the tool to which it corresponds

trans-unit.source: $TTF_ABSOLUTE - Positions the window at the same coordinates provided by TTM_TRACKPOSITION. (see Remarks)

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_ABSOLUTE - Positions the window at the same coordinates provided by TTM_TRACKPOSITION.
(see Remarks)

target.mrk: $TTF_ABSOLUTE - Positions the window at the same coordinates provided by TTM_TRACKPOSITION.
(see Remarks)

trans-unit.source: $TTF_TRANSPARENT- Causes the control to forward mouse messages to the parent window

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_TRANSPARENT- Causes the control to forward mouse messages to the parent window

target.mrk: $TTF_TRANSPARENT- Causes the control to forward mouse messages to the parent window

trans-unit.source: $TTF_PARSELINKS - Indicates that links in the control text should be displayed as links

seg-source.mrk: $TTF_PARSELINKS - Indicates that links in the control text should be displayed as links

target.mrk: $TTF_PARSELINKS - Indicates that links in the control text should be displayed as links

trans-unit.source: [optional] Application-defined value that is associated with the tool

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Application-defined value that is associated with the tool

target.mrk: [optional]
Application-defined value that is associated with the tool

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: None.

seg-source.mrk: None.

target.mrk: None.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Some internal properties of a tool are established when the tool is created, and are not recomputed when a $TTM_SETTOOLINFO message is sent.

seg-source.mrk: Some internal properties of a tool are established when the tool is created, and are not recomputed when a $TTM_SETTOOLINFO message is sent.

target.mrk: Some internal properties of a tool are established when the tool is created, and are not recomputed when a $TTM_SETTOOLINFO message is sent.

trans-unit.source: If you simply assign values to a TOOLINFO structure and pass it to the ToolTip control with a $TTM_SETTOOLINFO message, these properties may be lost.

seg-source.mrk: If you simply assign values to a TOOLINFO structure and pass it to the ToolTip control with a $TTM_SETTOOLINFO message, these properties may be lost.

target.mrk: If you simply assign values to a TOOLINFO structure and pass it to the ToolTip control with a $TTM_SETTOOLINFO message, these properties may be lost.

trans-unit.source: Instead your application should first request the tool's current TOOLINFO structure by sending a $TTM_GETTOOLINFO message.

seg-source.mrk: Instead your application should first request the tool's current TOOLINFO structure by sending a $TTM_GETTOOLINFO message.

target.mrk: Instead your application should first request the tool's current TOOLINFO structure by sending a $TTM_GETTOOLINFO message.

trans-unit.source: Then, modify the members of this structure as needed and pass it back to the ToolTip control with $TTM_SETTOOLINFO.

seg-source.mrk: Then, modify the members of this structure as needed and pass it back to the ToolTip control with $TTM_SETTOOLINFO.

target.mrk: Then, modify the members of this structure as needed and pass it back to the ToolTip control with $TTM_SETTOOLINFO.

trans-unit.source: When calling $TTM_SETTOOLINFO, the string pointed to by the Text member of the TOOLINFO structure must not exceed 80 characters in length.

seg-source.mrk: When calling $TTM_SETTOOLINFO, the string pointed to by the Text member of the TOOLINFO structure must not exceed 80 characters in length.

target.mrk: When calling $TTM_SETTOOLINFO, the string pointed to by the Text member of the TOOLINFO structure must not exceed 80 characters in length.
